00025 #include "lpc17xx_uart.h"

00036 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00037 /* Receive buffer size */
00038 #define RX_BUF_SIZE     0x10
00039 
00040 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00041 uint8_t menu1[] =
00042 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00043 "UART interrupt mode demo using ring buffer \n\r\t "
00044 "MCU LPC17xx - ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r\t "
00045 "UART0 - 9600bps \n\r"
00046 " This is a long string. It transferred in to DMA memory and transmit through Tx line \n\r"
00047 " on UART0 peripheral. To use UART with DMA mode, FIFO function must be enabled \n\r";
00048 
00049 uint8_t menu3[] = "UART demo terminated!\n";
00050 
00051 // Receive buffer
00052 __IO uint8_t rx_buf[RX_BUF_SIZE];
00053 
00054 // Terminal Counter flag for Channel 0
00055 __IO uint32_t Channel0_TC;
00056 
00057 // Error Counter flag for Channel 0
00058 __IO uint32_t Channel0_Err;
00059 
00060 // Terminal Counter flag for Channel 1
00061 __IO uint32_t Channel1_TC;
00062 
00063 // Error Counter flag for Channel 1
00064 __IO uint32_t Channel1_Err;
00065

00072 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00073 /*********************************************************************/
00078 void DMA_IRQHandler (void)
00079 {
00080         uint32_t tmp;
00081                 // Scan interrupt pending
00082         for (tmp = 0; tmp <= 7; tmp++) {
00083                 if (GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INT, tmp)){
00084                         // Check counter terminal status
00085                         if(GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INTTC, tmp)){
00086                                 // Clear terminate counter Interrupt pending
00087                                 GPDMA_ClearIntPending (GPDMA_STATCLR_INTTC, tmp);
00088 
00089                                 switch (tmp){
00090                                         case 0:
00091                                                 Channel0_TC++;
00092                                                 GPDMA_ChannelCmd(0, DISABLE);
00093                                                 break;
00094                                         case 1:
00095                                                 Channel1_TC++;
00096                                                 GPDMA_ChannelCmd(1, DISABLE);
00097                                                 break;
00098                                         default:
00099                                                 break;
00100                                 }
00101 
00102                         }
00103                                 // Check error terminal status
00104                         if (GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INTERR, tmp)){
00105                                 // Clear error counter Interrupt pending
00106                                 GPDMA_ClearIntPending (GPDMA_STATCLR_INTERR, tmp);
00107                                 switch (tmp){
00108                                         case 0:
00109                                                 Channel0_Err++;
00110                                                 GPDMA_ChannelCmd(0, DISABLE);
00111                                                 break;
00112                                         case 1:
00113                                                 Channel1_Err++;
00114                                                 GPDMA_ChannelCmd(1, DISABLE);
00115                                                 break;
00116                                         default:
00117                                                 break;
00118                                 }
00119                         }
00120                 }
00121         }
00122 }
00123 
00124 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00125 /*********************************************************************/
00130 int c_entry(void)
00131 {
00132         uint8_t *rx_char;
00133         uint32_t idx;
00134         // UART Configuration structure variable
00135         UART_CFG_Type UARTConfigStruct;
00136         // UART FIFO configuration Struct variable
00137         UART_FIFO_CFG_Type UARTFIFOConfigStruct;
00138         GPDMA_Channel_CFG_Type GPDMACfg;
00139         // Pin configuration for UART0
00140         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00141 
00142         /*
00143          * Initialize UART0 pin connect
00144          */
00145         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00146         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00147         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00148         PinCfg.Pinnum = 2;
00149         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00150         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00151         PinCfg.Pinnum = 3;
00152         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00153 
00154         /* Initialize UART Configuration parameter structure to default state:
00155          * Baudrate = 9600bps
00156          * 8 data bit
00157          * 1 Stop bit
00158          * None parity
00159          */
00160         UART_ConfigStructInit(&UARTConfigStruct);
00161 
00162         // Initialize UART0 peripheral with given to corresponding parameter
00163         UART_Init(LPC_UART0, &UARTConfigStruct);
00164 
00165 
00166         /* Initialize FIFOConfigStruct to default state:
00167          *                              - FIFO_DMAMode = DISABLE
00168          *                              - FIFO_Level = UART_FIFO_TRGLEV0
00169          *                              - FIFO_ResetRxBuf = ENABLE
00170          *                              - FIFO_ResetTxBuf = ENABLE
00171          *                              - FIFO_State = ENABLE
00172          */
00173         UART_FIFOConfigStructInit(&UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00174 
00175         // Enable DMA mode in UART
00176         UARTFIFOConfigStruct.FIFO_DMAMode = ENABLE;
00177 
00178         // Initialize FIFO for UART0 peripheral
00179         UART_FIFOConfig(LPC_UART0, &UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00180 
00181         // Enable UART Transmit
00182         UART_TxCmd(LPC_UART0, ENABLE);
00183 
00184 
00185         /* GPDMA Interrupt configuration section ------------------------------------------------- */
00186 
00187     /* Initialize GPDMA controller */
00188         GPDMA_Init();
00189 
00190 
00191         /* Setting GPDMA interrupt */
00192     // Disable interrupt for DMA
00193     NVIC_DisableIRQ (DMA_IRQn);
00194     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00195     NVIC_SetPriority(DMA_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00196 
00197 
00198         // Setup GPDMA channel --------------------------------
00199         // channel 0
00200         GPDMACfg.ChannelNum = 0;
00201         // Source memory
00202         GPDMACfg.SrcMemAddr = (uint32_t) &menu1;
00203         // Destination memory - don't care
00204         GPDMACfg.DstMemAddr = 0;
00205         // Transfer size
00206         GPDMACfg.TransferSize = sizeof(menu1);
00207         // Transfer width - don't care
00208         GPDMACfg.TransferWidth = 0;
00209         // Transfer type
00210         GPDMACfg.TransferType = GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_M2P;
00211         // Source connection - don't care
00212         GPDMACfg.SrcConn = 0;
00213         // Destination connection
00214         GPDMACfg.DstConn = GPDMA_CONN_UART0_Tx;
00215         // Linker List Item - unused
00216         GPDMACfg.DMALLI = 0;
00217         // Setup channel with given parameter
00218         GPDMA_Setup(&GPDMACfg);
00219 
00220         // Setup GPDMA channel --------------------------------
00221         // channel 1
00222         GPDMACfg.ChannelNum = 1;
00223         // Source memory - don't care
00224         GPDMACfg.SrcMemAddr = 0;
00225         // Destination memory
00226         GPDMACfg.DstMemAddr = (uint32_t) &rx_buf;
00227         // Transfer size
00228         GPDMACfg.TransferSize = sizeof(rx_buf);
00229         // Transfer width - don't care
00230         GPDMACfg.TransferWidth = 0;
00231         // Transfer type
00232         GPDMACfg.TransferType = GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_P2M;
00233         // Source connection
00234         GPDMACfg.SrcConn = GPDMA_CONN_UART0_Rx;
00235         // Destination connection - don't care
00236         GPDMACfg.DstConn = 0;
00237         // Linker List Item - unused
00238         GPDMACfg.DMALLI = 0;
00239         GPDMA_Setup(&GPDMACfg);
00240 
00241         /* Reset terminal counter */
00242         Channel0_TC = 0;
00243         /* Reset Error counter */
00244         Channel0_Err = 0;
00245 
00246     // Enable interrupt for DMA
00247     NVIC_EnableIRQ (DMA_IRQn);
00248 
00249         // Enable GPDMA channel 0
00250         GPDMA_ChannelCmd(0, ENABLE);
00251         // Make sure GPDMA channel 1 is disabled
00252         GPDMA_ChannelCmd(1, DISABLE);
00253 
00254         /* Wait for GPDMA on UART0 Tx processing complete */
00255     while ((Channel0_TC == 0) && (Channel0_Err == 0));
00256 
00257     // Main loop - echos back to the terminal
00258     while (1)
00259     {
00260         /* Reset terminal counter */
00261         Channel1_TC = 0;
00262         /* Reset Error counter */
00263         Channel1_Err = 0;
00264 
00265         // Setup channel with given parameter
00266         GPDMA_Setup(&GPDMACfg);
00267 
00268         // Enable GPDMA channel 1
00269         GPDMA_ChannelCmd(1, ENABLE);
00270 
00271         // Clear Rx buffer using DMA
00272         for (idx = 0; idx < RX_BUF_SIZE; idx++){
00273                 rx_buf[idx] = 0;
00274         }
00275 
00276         // now, start receive character using GPDMA
00277         rx_char = (uint8_t *) &rx_buf;
00278         while ((Channel1_TC == 0) && (Channel1_Err == 0)){
00279                         // Check whether if there's any character received, then print it back
00280                         if (*rx_char != 0)
00281                         {
00282                                 UART_Send(LPC_UART0, rx_char, 1, BLOCKING);
00283                                 rx_char++;
00284                         }
00285         }
00286     }
00287 
00288     // DeInitialize UART0 peripheral
00289     UART_DeInit(LPC_UART0);
00290 
00291     /* Loop forever */
00292     while(1);
00293     return 1;
00294 }
00295 
00296 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00297    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00298    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00299    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00300    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00301 int main(void)
00302 {
00303     return c_entry();
00304 }

00309 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number

00313 * @return               None
00314 *******************************************************************************/
00315 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00316 {
00317         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00318          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00319 
00320         /* Infinite loop */
00321         while(1);
00322 }
